intro: Pycreus limosus, commonly known as the swamp pycreus, is a rare and specialized aquatic plant found in freshwater wetlands. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant thrives in muddy or boggy environments, often with standing water, and is adapted to low-light conditions. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in dense clusters at the base of the plant. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Pycreus limosus is considered an indicator species for wetland health and biodiversity.
